comments.commentBody: Simple, pass the matter to Brewer and the Sheriff and put Romney in the White House and problem solved.......with Christian compassion of course.

People are behaving rationally here.  This is a direct result of the President's policy of letting young illegal aliens stay in the united States without fear of deportation.  It has given families a rational incentive to risk childern's lives to enter the United States without inspection.

Let them in, hey, our country is just one big free-for-all party, right? And we have totally unlimited wealth and resources!

This presents a perfect slippery-slope scenario. It seems the worst kind of injustice to deny children the protection our country can provide, but if we don't send one back within a week there will be two following him or her.

Hate to sound too jaded, but the fact is that if they made it this far they could make it home. It's terrible that they are away from their parents who are living here illegally, but we did not expend our efforts to build this nation up in order to dilute our wealth amongst people from failed states. And, in case you haven't noticed, the growth expected for the US is not on quite the same trajectory it was 100 or 200 years ago.
We have to conserve what is here for those who made it.

Part of the draw is the various amnesties and DREAM Act proposals being pushed by President Obama. Of course parents will send their kids north if they can get all these benefits. But we can't afford all these entitlements, and there are no decent-paying jobs for our own kids already without this competition from foreign youth. Seal the borders!

The problems which bring illegal immigrants from all over the world revolve around freedom and finance.  Parents of most of these children send their kids out of desperation If all countries in NAFTA and other trade agreement partners were made to pay and treat their workers equally a lot of the impetus for immigration would cease...A  living wage with benefits should prevail in all countries...It is time to have fair trade for all

How is it possible that parents of these lovely children, who themselves have been living in this country illegally, can show up at various courts and detention facilities to claim their children; and federal authorities are in no way concerned with the status of the parents?  Let's be honest...people who came here illegally and reside here illegally essentially cut in line in front of those who are taking the time to emigrate here within the law.  How is it that we don't take the parents own lawbreaking seriously?

It continues to surprise me when comments reveal that many Americans view ourselves and our country purely as victims of these undocumented immigrants (up to forty percent of whom may have a legal route of entry to the US). Trade policies from NAFTA have created untenable conditions for many Mexicans trying to earn a living. The drug war which is ravaging the north of the country is largely a result of US drug consumption habits and policy interference. Do you know why there is so much violence and money wrapped up in getting those drugs into our country? Because Americans demand them. People are buying them hand over fist for billions and billions of dollars a year. Mexicans don't consume even a fraction of the drugs Americans do.
Some commenters fear importing drug violence from Mexico; well, our country shipped hundreds of semi-automatic weapons into Mexico in 2010 and 2011 just to track who is buying them and where they are going. Shockingly, we discovered they are going to cartels in the drug war. They have been used to kill Mexican and American agents fighting against the cartels, as well as countless others. They could well be involved in the gun battles raging around this little girl's home in Taumalipas. So let's try to tone down the outrage just a bit shall we? We Americans and our country are part of the problem that brings these children to our doorstep.

Warning: occupancy levels and demands on life support systems have reached unprecedented levels on this spacecraft. Further reliable operation cannot be assured.

The crew.
Violeta Discua would do well to find a more productive way to spend her time with the feisty teenagers than helping them cop an attitude.

I read this article and then put it aside. It continues to haunt me. We live in the region highlighted in the article. I know from frequent local news articles the conditions across the border in Mexico. These children are fleeing violence and terrible living conditions. The fact that they are doing this alone is an indication of how desperate their conditions are at home.

Here they are thrown upon the mercy of the court without representation. Most are returned to their country of origin to what end? They will be at the mercy of the people and society that has shown them no mercy in the past. As I recall it is exactly these kind of children that Osama Bin Laden recruited and turned into radical fighters against the US and western interests.

If humanity doesn't convince us to take these children in and offer them a chance for a decent life then we deserve any consequences when they come knocking on our border when they are adults. Will they be productive and grateful well trained nurses? Will they be angry resentful drug dealers, smugglers and gang members? We have a choice to make and I believe we would be well served to take the high road, welcome these children, raise them well and they will be our friends and a valuable asset for our country. Perhaps some of them could even return to their country of origin and help to change things for those they left behind as children. If we were as smart as Osama Bin Laden, that is what we would do.

I just hate to read these sad stories, it rips me to shreds everytime I read a story like this. I was personally affected by such an American tragedy. This is the one single reason why Obama may lose the election. Can see my story documented here on my blog at http://alexastock.wordpress.com/2011/02/18/usa-deportee/

The immigration policies are poorly run and full of inconsistincies. It's left up to the judges to make a call which they are never fairly to all. Some gets preferential treatment while others are being held back and DGAS about.

Anyway my greatest concern are my kids who are in America who are wanting to see me and can't. This affect kids in a very bad way. My son who is 12 yrs old has been greatly afected in the worst of ways, failing grades and not being able to concentrate in class. My daughter seems to have surprisingly overcome this tragedy despite her being attached to me at the time but very distant now and not caring to talk to or hear from me.

As a man I want to be with my wife and children, I did not plan for it to happen this way. I was robbed of my family and will forever be terrified and depressed about it. Obama continues to destroy families across America.

why dont they empty out the prisons in the US? send the criminals back to central america. that would save the US millions. i spend time in mexico. you would not believe who has been deported, in 2006. 20somethings who came to the US @ 2 yrs old. they are educated, cant even use a rake properly. english is thier first language, they have administrative skills, & also fluent in spanish. they work odd jobs in mexico most of the time. they didnt get welfare in the US. meanwhile the US keeps the criminals, the drug dealers, the workers who have recently crossed the border & receive benefits. its backwards. why dont they start departing from the bottom, then evaluate the rest.

It's sad when adults do such thoughtless things and put their children through this kind of ordeal on their own. Sadly allowing any of these children to stay will only lead to more of them being smuggled in, subjecting even more of them to the danger of border crossing. The humane thing to do here is to turn back 100% of these children, to prevent a disastrous humanitarian crisis down the road.
I am also curious to know if you can cite the percentage of America's resources that illegal immigration is "sucking out?"

Being from Canada, you know not of what you speak.

Any child born on US soil becomes a citizen. The child and his/her mother then qualifies for free/subsidized housing, free healthcare, free food, and cash payments. These subsidizes increase with every child born to the mother. This costs the US taxpayers billions of dollars every year and has decimated entire cities on our border states.

Manual labor jobs are non-existent for the working poor, as wage competition has no meaning when businesses can simply hire illegal immigrants as slave laborers, so American citizens cannot find work and they themselves wind up on welfare.

Businesses offer illegal immigrants no health care, knowing that the workers need only go into an emergency room for free treatment, with the cost passed to the taxpayers. A win-win for the businesses. Elderly illegal immigrants need only get across the border for the same free treatment and sue at any attempt to deport them.

At least 5% of the population is made of of workers that not only contribute nothing to the country, they are well into the negative.

Americans welcome legal immigrants--they are why our culture and economy has grown and thrived for centuries--but we do not need are immigrants who arrive with the mindset of, 'What can this country do for me?'

We cannot afford it and we will not survive it and pretending the problem is not really a problem does nothing to move the dialogue forward to find a solution.

False. They take far more out of the economy than they contribute. They pay is so low (because they have no education or skills) that they pay no taxes. Their spending is insignificant so little benefit there. They freeload on ER for health care, and they do receive public assistance.

As for jobs Americans won't do, the argument is thin. More like at wages too low to work for because they undercut the labor market. And who did these jobs before illegal immigrants?

As for not understanding economics, you are the post child for economic ignorance on this issue.

"she was only doing what the supposed adults in her life told her to do"

And they should take the responsibility of taking her back since their advice failed. If the parents are here illegally, reunite them all and deport them.

"One of the reasons children have been forced to cross the border illegally is insecurity and violence in their home towns."

Possibly some, but the real reason is that they are extremely poor. Their own countries have forced them into a life of poverty.

Here's the problem. More than half the population of the world is poorer than Mexico and Central America. If we really believe (and it would be foolish to) that we should take in people because they are poor, shouldn't we be getting a few billion from Asia and Africa rather than those to our south? We cannot be the lifeboat to the world.

And illegal immigration has a huge effect on the US. Social costs like health and education are huge. Those we allow to stay will breed and their children and their descendants added to the population. We have the population growth rate of a third would country as it is. This leads to problems with water, power, highways, food supplies, urban sprawl, etc. We already get 340,000 anchor babies per year (born in the US to illegal parents so a consequence of illegal immigration) that take resources to the tune of may billions of dollars every year until they are adults. And there's a new crop every year. We get almost a million new illegal aliens a year. Over 2/3 of legal immigration is based solely on family relations and not on any other qualifications. Most of these need public assistance. This is why the population and the social costs are out of control.

"does no one here know the studies showing that immigration (even illegal immigration) adds to the US GDP"

Yes, and they are bogus studies by sociologists. Read the ones from labor economists.

"Brain drain is bad for the sending countries, but good for the US"

And this accounts for an infinitesimal portion of immigration. Most of immigration is illegal or by family relations, not education or skills. They are predominantly poor and likely to remain that way.

"is the only thing saving us from a greying society in population decline"

You don't save a country from a greying population by importing people who cost more per capita than they contribute. It would be cheaper to keep them out and eat the higher costs internally. Much of Western Europe has already seen this and they are more careful the we are about who gets to come in. If you restricted immigration to the smart, the educated, the highly skilled, there would be far less issue, but as I said, that's a drop in the immigration bucket.

" Many of these young immigrants could and do become citizens who make a significant contribution to our culture."

And the vast majority will not. They will remain unskilled and poor, depending on the taxpayers for support.

"It also seems prudent to remind readers that the the Mexicans inhabited those borderlands well before "we" did."

And even more prudent is to point out that the Mexican territory that is now part of the US was so sparsely populated by Mexicans that the Mexican government gave land grants to entice foreigners to come there. In Texas these settlers revolted against a hash government wanting independence, hardly an uncommon theme in the history of the world. In the other territories there were very few who came from what is now Mexico. The population was predominantly Spanish missionaries and Natives.

"You want cheap, non-complaining labor to pick your lettuce in the sun and clean your hotel rooms because ‘there are jobs Americans just will not do’, but then you want them to vanish."

Nope. Want employers to have to obey the law and pay enough for legal workers to do the jobs. It's really very little more than the illegals will take (as evidenced by places ICE has cleaned out a work force and it had to be replaced). Any extra cost of the goods and services from their labor are more than offset by the taxpayers' savings on the social costs and benefits of them and their families - education and health care being the largest.
The parents should be punished for child abandonment. And the kids sent home with them! We are a country, not an orphanage.

There are no one size fits all, some women thrive while at home with their children, others are miserable from social isolation, loss of personal identity and sometimes just the transition from working to child rearing is more then they can take. What needs to happen is that more of the stay at home mom's and the working mom's take care of each other. Stop sweating the small stuff and enjoy your time with your children.
The venom isn't against the children but against the notion that the US is responsible for the well being of the whole world.

I'm with you. I'm also a legal immigrant, and not through chain immigration. I got education and skills so I could get a visa and after citizenship, got more education. I pay taxes and have never gotten any public assistance except attending a state university after becoming a citizen.
